p: This is widely known as the source of tea leaves ( Camellia sinensis). It is a family of trees and shrubs grouped into approximately 250 species and around 28 genera, mainly found in tropical and temperate regions of East- and Southeastern Asia and Eastern North America through the Caribbean to South America. Several species are grown as ornamentals, mainly for their handsome, fragrant, and showy flowers, such as Stewartia and Polyspora. Saponins, alkaloids, tannins, and calcium oxalate crystals are usually found in the main species.
